snippet: Sweden was once one of the most welcoming countries for refugees. Now its officials say they fear becoming overwhelmed.
abstract: Sweden enacts legislation tightening rules for asylum seekers seeking permanent residency and making it harder for them to subsequently bring family members into country; human rights advocates see tougher rules as result of rise of right-wing anti-immigrant parties, with countries across Northern Europe pushing back against calls to accept more refugees.
lead_paragraph: Sweden was once one of the most welcoming countries for refugees. Now its officials say they fear becoming overwhelmed.

headline.main: Sweden Toughens Rules for Refugees Seeking Asylum
headline.print_headline: Feeling Strain of Refugees, Sweden Toughens Rules for Asylum

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
